byline.contributor: Susanne Craig contributed reporting from Cadyville, N.Y.

abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column observes that while fugitives Richard W Matt and David Sweat worked closely together during their escape, they may decide to separate to avoid authorities and civilians on the look out for two men; examines pros and cons of remaining together from fugitives' perspective.
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of officers and countless citizens in New York State are on the lookout for two escaped killers. When do two men become one too many?

headline.main: Weighing the Pros and Cons for 2 Escaped Convicts to Remain Partners in Crime
headline.print_headline: Escapees May Find Strength in Numbers, or That Two Can Be One Too Many

snippet: Hundreds of officers and countless citizens in New York State are on the lookout for two escaped killers. When do two men become one too many?
